subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|ヒイラギ}} {{wp|Osmanthus heterophyllus}} [[File:Osmanthus heterophyllus.jpg|thumb|250px|alt=Osmanthus heterophyllus|{{m|ja||柊|tr=hīragi}}: a [[holly osmanthus]]]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひいらぎ}} {{IPAfont|⟨pi1pi1ra ki2⟩}} → *{{IPAchar|/pʲipʲiraɡʷi/}} → {{IPAchar|/fifiraɡi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hiwiraɡi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hiːraɡi/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ひいらぎ|-}}, first attested in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' (720 {{CE}}). Appears to derive as the {{m|ja|連用形||tr=ren'yōkei|continuative or stem form}} of now-[[obsolete]] verb {{m|ja|疼ぐ||tr=hīragu|to [[hurt]] with a [[stinging]] [[pain]]}}, in reference to the sharp [[thorn]]s on the [[leaf|leaves]].{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} {{rfe|ja|extend for "spotnape ponyfish" sense}}
